intro: Stenogyne kauaulaensis, commonly known as the Kauaʻula ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland habitats, often forming dense thickets. Its woody structure and ability to thrive in harsh conditions make it an important component of native ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
